title: Callaloo & Saltfish Fritters
description: Crispy golden fritters filled with tender callaloo and flaked saltfish, seasoned with scallion, Scotch bonnet, and Caribbean spices. Pan-fried to a crunchy exterior and soft interior, served as a snack or appetizer with a tangy lime or pepper sauce.

ingredients.notes: soak in cold water overnight or at least 6 hours, change water once; remove skin and bones, flake
stems removed, blanched 1 minute and squeezed dry, finely chopped
about 1/2 cup to adjust batter consistency
white and green parts, thinly sliced

ingredients.display_name: Scotch bonnet pepper, seeded and minced
ingredients.notes: halve or omit for lower heat; adjust to taste
be cautious because saltfish is salty
enough for 1/4-inch shallow fry in skillet; amount may vary

ingredients.display_name: hot pepper sauce or dipping sauce (optional)

steps.text: Prepare saltfish by soaking to remove excess salt: drain and rinse soaked saltfish, place in a pot, cover with fresh cold water, bring to a gentle simmer for 8-10 minutes to finish desalting, then drain, cool slightly and flake fish, removing any skin and bones.

Blanch callaloo: bring a small pot of water to a boil, add callaloo leaves for 30-60 seconds until wilted, immediately transfer to ice water or rinse under cold water, squeeze out excess water and chop finely.

Sauté aromatics: heat 1 tbsp oil in a skillet over medium heat, add diced onion, scallions, garlic, minced scotch bonnet (if using) and thyme; cook until softened and fragrant, about 2-3 minutes; remove from heat and let cool slightly.

Combine batter: in a mixing bowl whisk flour and baking powder; add beaten egg and milk, stir until just combined into a thick batter; fold in flaked saltfish, chopped callaloo and sautéed aromatics, season with black pepper and salt only if necessary; adjust consistency with a splash of water or milk so batter drops from a spoon.

Heat oil for frying: pour oil into a wide skillet to about 1/4-inch depth and heat over medium-high until shimmering and a small dollop of batter sizzles and browns in about 20-30 seconds (approx 180°C / 350°F).

Fry fritters: using two spoons or a small ice cream scoop, drop 2 tbsp portions of batter into the hot oil without crowding; fry 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown and crisp; work in batches and adjust heat to maintain color without burning.
Drain and keep warm: transfer cooked fritters to a rack or paper towel-lined tray to drain excess oil; keep warm in a low oven if needed while finishing remaining batter.
Serve: plate fritters with lime wedges and optional hot pepper or dipping sauce; garnish with extra scallions or thyme and serve hot.
